subject: RE: [junit] JUnit or Unit Testing Wiki
msgSnippet: And http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?TestingFramework doesn t help you? I don t think you ll typically find knowledge resources that contain ONLY what you happen to
messageBody:
And http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?TestingFramework doesn't help you?

I don't think you'll typically find knowledge resources that
contain ONLY what you happen to seek.

- George

-----Original Message-----
From: Hugo Garcia [mailto:elhugonyc@...]
Sent: Wednesday, March 21, 2001 1:09 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit or Unit Testing Wiki


yup

you hit the mark and get the cigar.

This is what I was looking for :

UnitTestingRuby
UnitTesstingJava
UnitTestingJavaAbstractClasses
UnitTestingJavaPrivateMembers
UnitTestingPython

etc...

Most of this info is contained within the XP and junit mailing lists or
obfuscated within Ward's wiki. Don't get me wrong here, I think Ward's wiki
is
an excellent resource and when combined with the current junit docs and, for
those of us that like theory, Binder's book it it excellent way of learning
Unit Testing. Yet I think there are a lot of newbies and experts that would
appreciate a wiki were we can find what we need without the need of reading
20+
emails. Also, since we refactor mercilesly is there a place that complements
the refactoring with UnitTestingMoveMethod.

This is what I would like to see. [Is the above a System Metaphor?]

So before Kent says it I will say it to myself "Well then write it."

Anybody has any comments, suggestions, a box with a fresh wiki install?

-H

--- Michael Finney <mfinney@...> wrote:
> Well... being "done with it" may mean the person was tired of reading
what
> was there.
>
> I think the hope is that a wiki site devoted to unit testing would more of
> what the person is looking for.
>
> Michael Finney
> Sun Certified Programmer for the Java 2 Platform
> Sun Certified Developer for the Java 2 Platform
>
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Dinwiddie, George [SMTP:George.Dinwiddie@...]

> > Subject: RE: [junit] JUnit or Unit Testing Wiki
> >
> > Are you looking to add more or read more?
> >
> > If you want to add more, Ward's wiki at c2.com has plenty of room.
> >
> > If you want to read more, all I can say is Wow! You've read all
> > that's on c2.com and still want more? Have you followed links
> > from there to the testing frameworks for the language you're
> > using?
> >
> > - George
